casebody.data:
Case No. 4,334. ELDRIDGE et al. v. FORTY-ONE BARS OF RAILROAD IRON.

[N. Y. Times.

June 17. 1854.] District Court, S. D. New York. June 15, 1854. Owen & Betts, for libellants. Morton & Haskett, for claimants. DEGREED BY THE COURT:

That the libellants recover the sum of $100, being the amount of the tender, and that against this the costs of the respondents should be set off pro tanto.
